Type changed

Perhaps a wp-sitemap.php similar in fashion to wp-rss.php and the like.

You are aware that there is already a ​plugin to do this, though?

item.title: Ticket #3764 (Selectable Output) updated
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
I'm a little edgy on this one. XHTML is the future of HTML, and is well-supported enough in older browsers; it seems pointless to be to go backwards.

If this were an option, this would be added in the theme code, not as a user-selectable option in the WordPress Administration.

item.title: cron.php.diff attached to Ticket #3765
item.dc:creator: dragonhard
item.description: Patch for infinite SSL-Loop in Wordpress 2.1

item.title: Ticket #3765 (Cron creates infinite Loop when using Wordpress with SSL) created
item.dc:creator: dragonhard
item.description: In Wordpress 2.1 the Cron.php calles every second itself and blockes the server. This only happens when using the Wordpress-Blog with ssl under https. The infinite Loop causes serious problems in the server performance. Problem appeared since Wordpress 2.1.

item.title: Ticket #3670 (Removing CDATA close tag ( ]]> ) unbalances the CDATA block) updated
item.dc:creator: scenic
item.description: Andy, I agree that the filter is saving me from needing that line. But, embedded JS is a valid thing to do in the content. That replace function should only really happen when we are processing a feed. The global is_feed() (I think) method should just wrap that line at a minimum.

item.title: Ticket #3723 (Tagging) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Here's an untested, partial patch that lays some groundwork for using the categories table for tags. A tagged_count field in the categories table tracks number of posts/pages using the tag and a new post2tag associates posts to tags.

I'm thinking queries for categories should query both categories and tags. category_name would match a proper category named "foo" or a tag named "foo" (which are the same object in the DB). Given one post categorized as "foo" and another tagged as "foo", a category query for "foo" would match both. This means that the /category/foo/ permalink is both a category and tag permalink. The user could set the permalink to be /tag/foo/ if so desired.

As for template functions, there will be separate API for tags so that themes can display category and tag info for a post separately. We might want a way for themes to say "combine tags and categories" so that they can exclusively use the category template functions. In this situation, get_the_category(), for example, would return both tags and categories.

item.title: tags.diff attached to Ticket #3723
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Tagging using categories and post2tag tables

item.title: Ticket #3760 (Page Management Page order backwards in 2.1) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan

item.title: Ticket #3762 (Trying to get property of non-object) created
item.dc:creator: darkfate
item.description:
I don't have notices disabled in PHP since I'm working in a development environment. I don't know if this notice comes up anywhere else, but the page where you create the wp-config file it says:

Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in C:\Apache2\htdocs\wp\wp-includes\functions.php on line 1316

I think this is a PHP5 specific thing, but I'm not sure. It may be related to the way PHP5 uses destruct to shutdown functions in reverse order.

item.title: Ticket #3761 (2.1 wp_list_bookmarks breaks validation) created
item.dc:creator: tandilboy
item.description:
i using 

wp_list_bookmarks("title_li=&category_name=Secciones&orderby=rating&before=
<li>&after=</li>&show_description=0");

the null title_li generates 

<li></li>

and breakes validation.

in null cases the 

<li></li>

is really useless

item.title: Ticket #3760 (Page Management Page order backwards in 2.1) created
item.dc:creator: here
item.description:
Page Management Page order backwards in 2.1

As described and solved at ​forum topic 102764: Page Management Page order backwards in 2.1

The admin page wp-admin/edit-pages.php , "Page Management" lists pages in an order different from that specified by 'page order' variable. This was not a problem in 2.0.7.
